page.title: 01BEER
page.content:
Beer is a small village on the coast of East Devon.It nestles deep in a valley leading to the sea.During the summer the population grows as Beer swells with visitors.The beach obviously is an attraction.The pebbles curve in a crescent shape facing south and south east and the beach is backed by white cliffs which makes it a sun trap.
The area immediately around Beer is rural and agricultural.It is an area of flat topped hills deeply cut by valleys.Beer also has had interests in quarrying,the Beer stone can be seen in some cathedrals and many local churches.Fishing used to play a more prominent part in the village,but now tourism is one of the main occupations.
